column4: hmm....ok I can write to my slave drive...any one have an idea why...I mounted in fstab like this...: /dev/hdd1   /media/windows   ext3       defaults         0      0
is the drive NTFS or FAT32?
oh, I was just wondering why you were mounting it to /media/windows.  if it's ext3, your user doesn't have permission
should I umount the drive first?
no, you need to do that with the drive mounted
seems to work...but how do I make it mount on bootup
if it's in your fstab, it will do
unless you have 'user' in the options
so just have it like I showed a few ago?
it doesn't need to be brought up with '/'
